prior_works.title: Nonlinear Independent Component Analysis: Existence and Uniqueness Results
prior_works.authors: Aapo Hyvärinen, Erkki Oja, Olli Pajunen
prior_works.role: Foundational impossibility result for unsupervised nonlinear ICA
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established that nonlinear ICA is unidentifiable without additional structure or side information, motivating the search for structural assumptions that the present paper generalizes.

prior_works.title: Unsupervised Feature Extraction by Time-Contrastive Learning and Nonlinear ICA
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showed identifiability using nonstationarity (auxiliary variables), providing a contrasting pathway that the current paper intentionally avoids by pursuing structural conditions instead.

prior_works.title: Variational Autoencoders and Nonlinear ICA: A Unifying Framework
prior_works.authors: Ilyes Khemakhem, Diederik P. Kingma, Rikuoja Lehtinen, Aapo Hyvärinen
prior_works.role: Modern identifiability via conditional exponential families (iVAE)
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Unified nonlinear ICA with VAEs under auxiliary variables, highlighting limits of classic ICA assumptions and informing how identifiability can be recovered under relaxed independence—an aspect extended here via grouped/dependent sources.

prior_works.title: Identifiability of Nonlinear ICA under Structural Sparsity
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduced identifiability from sparse source–observation connectivity in the unsupervised setting; the present work directly generalizes this to undercompleteness, partial sparsity, and dependent/grouped sources while relaxing bijectivity and full independence.

prior_works.title: Independent Subspace Analysis
prior_works.role: Template for handling dependent sources via grouping
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided the principled notion of groups (subspaces) with dependence within groups and independence across groups, which informs this paper’s extension to flexible grouping structures and source dependence.

prior_works.title: Blind Source Separation by Sparse Decomposition
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated how sparsity enables separation with fewer sensors than sources; this idea underpins the paper’s move beyond complete/bijective mixing to undercomplete and partially sparse regimes.

prior_works.title: Source Separation in Post-Nonlinear Mixtures
prior_works.role: Early identifiability under constrained nonlinear mixing
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showed identifiability for structured nonlinear mixing (post-nonlinear), foreshadowing the use of structural constraints—extended here from parametric forms to general sparse connectivity and relaxed bijectivity.

synthesis_narrative:
The paper’s core contribution—general identifiability of nonlinear ICA under undercompleteness, partial sparsity, dependence, and flexible grouping—builds on a progression from impossibility to structured recoverability. Hyvärinen and colleagues’ classic impossibility result established that unsupervised nonlinear ICA cannot be identified without additional structure, catalyzing two main lines of work: auxiliary-variable approaches and structural constraints. Auxiliary-variable methods such as Time-Contrastive Learning and iVAE reintroduced identifiability by leveraging nonstationarity or observed conditioning, but they require side information. In contrast, the authors’ prior work on structural sparsity showed that identifiability can be achieved purely from sparse source–observation connectivity in unsupervised settings, albeit under bijective mixing and fully independent sources.
This paper generalizes that structural route in three directions. First, inspired by sparsity-based blind source separation in underdetermined regimes, it relaxes bijectivity and allows undercomplete settings and partial sparsity. Second, drawing on Independent Subspace Analysis, it moves beyond fully independent sources to grouped structures with within-group dependence. Third, echoing early post-nonlinear identifiability, it broadens the space of structural constraints from specific parametric forms to flexible connectivity assumptions. Together, these influences yield new identifiability results that subsume earlier structurally sparse nonlinear ICA, bridging gaps between auxiliary-variable identifiability, sparse underdetermined separation, and grouped-source models to better match practical, non-ideal mixing conditions.
